intro: Cousinia consanguinea, commonly known as the bloodroot cousinia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low-growing herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Cousinia consanguinea is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
